body: Thanks.

It builds for Mac so it must build for iOS.
You could try to build it with the iPhone SDK and XCode and keep us updated with the compilation log.

Hi,

Considering the translation does not affect the results.
But I will consider your remark. Thanks.

Regards

the full formula for converting a point from image to world coordinates is:
x = (u_depth, v_depth, depth)
X = R.t() \* K.inv() \* x + C
getting the ray:
ray = X - C
and thus C is not needed, neither the depth which will be removed during normalization

the problem in your code is that you forget to add C so that substracting it at the end is therefore incorrect
Thanks to cdcseacave it's now fixed in the develop branch.

Some tests failed:

The following tests FAILED:
      9 - openMVG_test_triangulation_nview (SEGFAULT)
     15 - openMVG_test_solver_resection_kernel (SEGFAULT)
     22 - openMVG_test_robust_estimator_MaxConsensus (SEGFAULT)
     23 - openMVG_test_robust_estimator_Ransac (SEGFAULT)
     24 - openMVG_test_robust_estimator_LMeds (SEGFAULT)
     25 - openMVG_test_robust_estimator_ACRansac (SEGFAULT)

And i tried your test block, though i modified it this way, so it matches a bit more with the original one:
{
        std::map<size_t, Mat34> map_test;
        Mat34 P;
        map_test.insert(std::make_pair(3, P));
}
And it fails. It works though with Mat3.

What do you suggest? I'm planning to run this later on Android, but if Eigen cant be cross compiled and run on a non x64 system, i dont see much hope.
Will test further.

thanks, appreciate your help!

Hi, this is a memory alignment issue with the stl container and Eigen matrices.
I will check this next week because I have solved it on Windows.
Look to numeric.h header.

Thanks for the investigation.

Regards,
Pierre

Hi Romain,

Not for the moment.
I prefer consider one day adding a six point based solver (For pose and Focal length estimation).

Do you know how is done Autocalibration in Apero ?

Regards,
Pierre

Hi,
Thanks for your comments.

The code don't need to by modified.
The code already able to do full 360° reconstruction.

In your case, you only need to provide a better initial focal length : not 600 but 1760.

The obtained calibration point cloud:
https://docs.google.com/file/d/0BwmCHSSuFIMoLXNjdnNrd0c5SEk/edit?usp=sharing

The obtained dense PMVS output:
https://docs.google.com/file/d/0BwmCHSSuFIMoR0tBdUVYR3B4Z3c/edit?usp=sharing

Regards,
Pierre

Thank you very much for your help and kindness. I am very pleased to hear
it is able to achieve the results i need :)

I'm going to port and optimize your library for Android. If i resolve any
issues i encounter during the process that might contain beneficial
information for you, i'll let you know!

thanks again!
wish the best,
Andrew

thanks Pierre,

I made a deeper look into openMVG source code tonight and now I found my previous question was obviously stupid. In fact Apero, can initialize intrinsic parameters with EXIF data as Bundler and... openMVG. But my error lead me to another question. From the test i've made until now, i'm very impressed by speed and accuracy of openMVG and it's also a clean, maintained and organized code. To unveil my plan, as an ArcheOS ;) maintainer,  I'm studying opportunity to replace the  good ol' Bundler by openMVG in the PPT pipeline. But Archaeological photogrammetry surveys can make extensive use of wide-angle lenses or super-wide zoom (I'm not talking about fisheyes, I know that's a different kettle of fish). These optics can produce strong distortion... so what about estimation of additional intrinsic parameters in openMVG in the future  (ok, sorry if it look like a Santa Claus letter !) ? Or do you recommend to use a software with camera and lens profile to perform distortion correction before ? Or did I miss something again...?

I know it's off-topic and, as Andrew, I'm sorry to report that as an "issue", it's only by pure curiosity... what's you're feeling about replacing Bundler with openMVG in the PPT ?

Regards,
Romain.

Hi Romain,

Thanks for the remark and the congratulations.

In order to plan an integration in ArcheOS it missed two main point (one you have cited).

-> The SfM demonstrator support actually only a sequence acquired with one focal lenght. I plan to extend the chain when I will have more time.

-> I prefer that the distortion is corrected before. I have to investigate the quality of the OpenCV calibration engine in order to see if we can do a solution by ourself to propose a calibration of the camera and the lens in order to distort the picture and run the SfM chain safely. (We can also look to see the existing openSource solution that exists)

My feeling about replacing Bundler by openMVG ?
I'm for this kind of change, it could be an excellent opportunity for some student to add functionality.
But yet it's not feasible, the two point cited before have to be managed.

Regards,
Pierre
Have you find a fix ?
Havent looked into it yet, installed an x64 OS instead for the moment.

Hi Pierre,

Thanks for this detailed answer ! I found in the Ceres solver documentation that It shouldn't be difficult to add more cameras parameters (at first glance...). Maybe If I have time and necessary skills on my side I can try to do something on the two "problematics" points. But I'm afraid that I couldn't build something strong on this topic, given that I came from Humanities :). For now, if you are interested by an "exportToMicMac" function I think I could handle that...

with all my support regarding your work,
Regards,
Romain

> 1. Follow the instructions for Mac OS in the BUILD file
> 2. Open Xcode project in order to perform the following changes:
> 
> >  2.1 Change architecture to "armv7 armv7s i386"
> > 
> >  2.2 Change Base SDK to iOS
> > 
> >  2.3 Change valid architectures to "armv7 armv7s i386"
> > 
> >  2.4 If necessary because of external dependencies change C++ Language Dialect and Standard Library
> > 3. Build all target libraries for archive

Thanks to C. Herbon for the architecture change settings.

Hi Dan,
Thanks for your interest about openMVG and the AC-RANSAC

Have you used the openMVG implementation or re-write you own ?
- The results do not depends of the number of corresponding points. You can see here that 1 point among 6 is detected as outlier https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG/blob/develop/src/openMVG/robust_estimation/robust_estimator_ACRansac_test.cpp.  Using a max threshold could be necessary to avoid some spurious case. Some additional sample shows that it works well for essential matrix the https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG/blob/develop/src/openMVG_Samples/robust_essential/robust_essential.cpp. Perhaps your data do not have clear outliers. You must notice that the error model is not the same for point to line model (essential or fundamental) or point to point (resection) (check the SFMIncremetal implementation). As the method is adaptive, it works better with rectified images.
- Second point about the speed. There is no extra 10% iteration. Once a meaningful model is found, the number of iteration for optimization is reduced to 10% of the number of original iteration count. AC-RANSAC could be slower than RANSAC due to the probabillity computation but often the iteration reduction make it as fast as RANSAC. There is a price to cost to support a clean statistic noise adaptivity.

Please consider this mail address to continue the discussion:
openMVG-team@googlegroups.com

Thanks,
Pierre

Thanks, Pierre, for the quick reply. In order to implement it, I copied almost untouched the core (ACRANSAC and bestNFA routines) and for the rest my own code. For computing the error in the case of the essential matrix I use squared Sampson error (as in HZ eq 11.9). For resection I use squared reprojection error. All points are pseudo-normalized in the case of E (centered and divided by the width of the image) so K is composed only of focal-length/width. Is this a problem? Otherwise, for the same cases, my old MSAC estimator correctly finds all the inliers (permited by the threshold).

As for the speed, I was indeed speaking about those 10% iterations at the end, which are invariable performed. For instance if max iterations is 1000 and the best solution is found from the first iteration, ACRANSAC always runs 1+100 ietrations. MSAC drops the number of iterations even to 10 or lower.

My opinion would be : 
- 1. A test with your images or data the openMVG essential matrix sample,
- 2.
  - If 1. is working, put some doubt in your implementation or usage of openMVG based code,
  - If 1. is not working we will be able to look together to the problem.

In my case I use the ACKernelAdaptorResection_K or and ACKernelAdaptorEssential template class that make normalization stuff accordingly.
You will see that when K is used with image coordinates points inv(K) is applied.
When K is not used ACKernelAdaptorResection, point are normalized with the image size.
Notice also : 
- point to point logalpha0_ and multError 
- point to line another logalpha0_ and multError initialization

Please find included the results of the test you proposed on a small photo-set of 15 images circular around an object. The images below represent the image pairs matched with green; the first one the results of "robust_essential" from OpenMVG, and the second my MSAC implementation. The results from your code is identical to the one I get with my implementation of ACRANSAC. Below you can find the log with detailed inliers/total matches for "robust_essential".

Thanks for have shared your experiment.

Have you take a look to the threshold and the NFA value found by the ACRANSAC ?
Have you tried to look at the matches that ACRANSAC consider as correct for the spurious pair ?

I think that the pair you said that are not rejected have a large threshold (So that ACRANSAC have found a possible solution but not a log of confidence on it).
The NFA value is indicating the confidence about the consensus model that have been found for the validated model.

You could setup an upper bound if you want to avoid such large threshold to be found.
You can test a value of 4.0 pixels for the provided precision.

PS : openMVG-team@googlegroups.com will be a better place to continue the discussion
Bug in writing color PNG.

ACRANSAC is working fine.
The encountered error was due to a confusion in the usage of the ACKernelAdaptorEssential adaptor.

openMVG depends on an external library for openGL window creation (GLFW).
It's seems in your case that the library have not been checkout.
This external dependency is checkout out by using git submodule.

Take a look to build instruction (BUILD file at the top of the source).
Getting the sources:
$ git clone --recursive https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG.git
recursive will get all the external dependancies
or do it by hand
$ git clone https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG.git
$ cd openMVG
$ git submodule init
$ git submodule update

Thank you. But the problem is still not solved. I tried the --recursive option. It failed midway giving the below log

I later tried changing git:// to https:// in git://github.com/elmindreda/glfw.git. It then allowed me to checkout glfw folder. finally  :-) However I noticed that glfw folder has below file GLFW/glfw3.h. But "GL/glfw3.h" is what is expected! So apparently something is still not correct. (just changing "GL/glfw3.h" to "GLFW/glfw3.h" resulted in compile time prototype mismatch in the file "......\src\software\SfMViewer\main.cpp " for functions glfwSetWindowCloseCallback() and glfwSetKeyCallback() 

Can you please suggest/help?

Hi,
The problem is due to the fact that the glfw version you have is not the one I want.
The classic git pipeline check a specific revision of the glfw repo.
That do not seems to be right for you.

please do the following
cd src/dependencies/glfw
git checkout 2939c1dc358df78b419c8f6e468025b04d9f8632

redo the cmake operation and eveything will be good.

I think when you have change git to https and git submodule udpate you don't saw the message 
$ git submodule update
Cloning into 'src/dependencies/glfw'...
